item.title: "Three leading Colorado Democratic officials on Monday...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Three leading Colorado Democratic officials on Monday called on the state party to censure U.S. Sen. John Hickenlooper over the Democrat's support on a non-binding vote last week to block undocumented immigrants from receiving pandemic stimulus payments.

Hickenlooper has been under fire for days from furious immigrant-rights advocates and others he can typically count as allies since the lawmaker joined seven other Democratic senators last Thursday night supporting a Republ...

Continue ReadingIn a letter to state Democratic Party chair Morgan Carroll, the state's three elected Democratic National Committee members ‚Äî Joe Salazar, Jeri Shepherd and Radhika Nath ‚Äî demanded what appears

item.title: ***Sigue en espa√±ol*** On February 4th, newly-elected Senator...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

***Sigue en espa√±ol***

On February 4th, newly-elected Senator John Hickenlooper voted alongside Republicans in favor of an amendment that would deny undocumented immigrants access to federal COVID relief. His vote was for a non-binding amendment, one of hundreds that will guide the actual policy of the bill that will be voted on in the coming weeks. Before that vote happens, we must show Senator Hickenlooper that his stance is unacceptable. Coloradans want COVID relief for ev...eryone. Join us on Tuesday to demand that the senator support stimulus checks for every member of our community.
El 4 de febrero, el senador John Hickenlooper vot√≥ junto con los republicanos a favor de una enmienda que negar√≠a a los inmigrantes indocumentados el acceso al alivio federal de COVID. Su voto fue a favor de una enmienda no vinculante, una de las cientos que guiar√°n la pol√≠tica real del proyecto de ley que se votar√°n en las pr√≥ximas semanas. Antes de que ocurra esa votaci√≥n, debemos mostrarle al senador Hickenlooper que su postura es inaceptable. Los habitantes de Colorado quieren un alivio de COVID para todos. √önete a nosotros el martes para exigir que el senador apoye los cheques de est√≠mulo para cada miembro de nuestra comunidad.

TUE, FEB 9

Car Rally for COVID Relief

item.title: "Prisoners at the St. Louis City Justice Center have been...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Prisoners at the St. Louis City Justice Center have been protesting since December for safe and humane conditions during the COVID pandemic. They have faced extremely serious retaliation including what appears to be intentional exposure to COVID-infected inmates.

The conditions they are rising up against are shared by prisoners and ICE detainees all across the country. We know full well that these conditions are present in Denver and across the state of Colorado.

Join us Wed...nesday at 5:30pm for a solidarity rally at the Denver City Jail where speakers will share words from inside the St. Louis City Justice Center and insights into the realities inside local jail and prison facilities.

We demand mass humanitarian release of prisoners, safe and humane conditions, and an end to retaliation against prisoners who speak out about abuses and unsafe conditions."

#FreeThemAll

See More

HAPPENING NOW

Solidarity with St. Louis & All Prisoners! Rally at Denver City Jail

Denver City JailCauses ¬∑ 111 people

item.content:encoded:

"Union del Barrio understands that deportations will not stop because Trump is no longer president. We will continue utilizing our community patrols as a tool for fighting back against ICE raids in our San Diego communities. Our patrols have successfully documented and in some cases, halted ICE raids altogether. We will be sharing our thoughts and insight on our community patrols and giving info on how folks can get involved in protecting our people from Migra/police terrorism."

"It was at least the third disturbance at the CJC in recent weeks. One occurred the last week of December and a second just days later. In those cases inmates had expressed concern about unsafe conditions amid the coronavirus pandemic."

item.title: Call to Action! Stand with Sanctuary4All Colorado by calling on...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Call to Action!
Stand with Sanctuary4All Colorado by calling on Senator Hickenlooper to support immigrant communities!

This week, Senator Hickenlooper turned his back on the immigrant community in Colorado and around the country by supporting a move to block undocumented families from receiving COVID relief checks. While the vote was non-binding, he needs to hear from constituents that these decisions that hurt those most vulnerable to the pandemic will not be tolerated, bef...ore he does it again.

Sanctuary 4 All, a grassroots organization that advocates for the immigrant community in Colorado, has put out a call to action for Coloradans to voice their anger over Hickenlooper‚Äôs vote.

WHY: Coloradans elected Senator Hickenlooper to support everyone, regardless of their legal status. He needs to know that this is an unacceptable position to take and that we will hold him accountable.

HOW: Call Senator Hickenlooper today at 202-224-5941 to let him know that everyone deserves relief from the COVID-19 pandemic and that his actions matter to the people of Colorado.

SAMPLE SCRIPT:
My name is [FULL NAME] and I live in [COMMUNITY/ZIP CODE].
I am calling because I am deeply disturbed by Senator Hickenlooper‚Äôs vote to block undocumented families from receiving COVID relief checks. Everyone in Colorado and around the country deserves support during this pandemic, especially immigrant communities that can be even more vulnerable. As his constituent, I will continue to hold Hickenlooper accountable for all of his votes and demand that he support immigrant families.

GOAL: DSURJ‚Äôs goal is to generate at least 20 calls by the end of the weekend to send a clear message to Hickenlooper that we are watching each and every one of his votes.

Comment below to let us know you've reached out and please share!

See More

item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: This New Year‚Äôs Eve, please join the @denvercommunists and other activists across the Colorado Front Range who have...
item.content:encoded:
This New Year’s Eve, please join the @denvercommunists and other activists across the Colorado Front Range who have organized a noise demonstration in solidarity with our incarcerated neighbors and political prisoners like anarchist, activist, and poet, Eric King.

What better way is there to show solidarity other than showing up, making some noise & closing out this shit show of a year together? Show up with your best NYE noise makers, demonstration banners and signs. Who knows, we may even try out a new flavor of Pig face? Fed or Jeffco anyone?

We are planning on meeting up at Harriman Lake Park at 7:30 pm at W Quincy Ave & S. Kipling Pkwy, then heading to the facility which is across the street at 9595 W Quincy Ave Littleton, CO 80123.

**Neither we, nor the other organizers of this action, are affiliated in any way with Eric King nor the Eric King Support team @SupportEricKing. We all just want to show some love and and we are happy to signal boost that!**

“I have been incredibly fortunate to have so many people come into my life and take a stand with me so that I didn’t have to face this shit alone… From the smallest greeting to the big gestures, everything has meant so much to me… Now that said, I stand by my actions... After seeing what happened in Ferguson, so close down the road, I was disgusted by the lack of mobilization in my city. Three hours away people were fighting for their lives and we weren’t even taking to the streets. We were doing nothing. My act as a very personal display of my anger and rage toward the state as well as an act of solidarity to everyone in Ferguson. We never know our own strength until we are tested and even with my ridiculous sentence I feel at least proud to have been able to stand strong and refuse to cooperate with the state. I am just really happy that I don’t have to take this alone and have so many amazing people standing next to me. Until all are free.”
— Eric King

https://unicornriot.ninja/2016/eric-king-given-10-yr-sentence-throwing-molotovs-empty-govt-building/
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of ‚ÄúThe Facility.‚Äù ...
item.content:encoded:
Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of “The Facility.”

“The Facility” is a short documentary film chronicling the lived experiences of immigrants being held at the GEO detention facility in Aurora, Colorado. This film addresses the personal loss and consequences caused by for-profit detention and the federal government's broken immigration policies. Legal and medical experts highlight horrific abuses including death, medical neglect, nutrition issues, and prolonged detention during the coronavirus pandemic. To tell their stories, current and former detainees, families fighting to be reunited, and advocates come together to share their experiences behind the walls of the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora.

@acluofcolorado @coloradopeoplesalliance @co_immigrant @keshagrijalva @_floodlight_

Following the screening will be a Q&A session with the director, legal experts, and individuals featured in the film with first-hand experience of the systemic abuse occurring inside the facility.

Panelists include:

Jeremy Flood, “The Facility” Director
Raul Medina Perez, COPA, Community Organizer who was formerly detained at GEO
Kesha Davalos Grijalva, Immigrant rights advocate whose husband is detained at GEO
Keinada Andereas, Colorado Student who was formerly detained at GEO
Hans Meyer, The Meyer Law Office, Lead Attorney
Denise Maes, ACLU of Colorado, Public Policy Director

Please RSVP for the screening in advance for this free event: https://aclu.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_nUbTy8-VQpif8nMzqtUzQw

Trailer: https://youtu.be/cGOCejy48Jo

“The Facility” is presented by ACLU of Colorado, Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition, and Colorado Hispanic Bar Association.
